title: Jaya Hartono
text:
Jaya Hartono (born October 20, 1963 in <a href="Medan">Medan</a>, <a href="North%20Sumatera">North Sumatera</a>) is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach from <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>. He coached <a href="Persib%20Bandung">Persib Bandung</a> from 2008 to 2010. He previously served as coach at <a href="Deltras%20Sidoarjo">Deltras Sidoarjo</a>. He played football on clubs and the national team.
Playing career.
He played at the Galatama competition in the 1980s. He played on championship team Niac Mitra in 1987 and runner-up in 1989. He finished his career at <a href="Persik%20Kediri">Persik Kediri</a> in 2000. He played for the following teams:
Managerial career.
Jaya debuted on the <a href="Indonesia%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> in 1986, competing in the <a href="1986%20Asian%20Games">1986 Asian Games</a>. The team reached the semifinals, but were defeated by <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">South Korea</a>. He again played on the national team when it won the gold medal at the <a href="1987%20SEA%20Games">1987 SEA Games</a> and also on the <a href="Indonesia%20Independence%20Cup">Indonesia Independence Cup</a> in 1986 with <a href="Robby%20Darwis">Robby Darwis</a>.
